# Identifying a network address using CIDR

128 64 32 16 8 4 2 1

```
192.168.1.10/24 -> IP
11000000.10101000.00000001.00001010

11111111.11111111.11111111.00000000
255.255.255.0 -> Netmask

11000000.10101000.00000001.00000000
192.168.1.0 -> network address

00000000.00000000.00000000.11111111
0.0.0.255

192.168.1.255 -> Broadcast

254 usable hosts
```
```
192.168.1.25/25 -> IP
11000000.10101000.00000001.00011001

11111111.11111111.11111111.10000000
255.255.255.128 -> Netmask

11000000.10101000.00000001.10000000
192.168.1.128 -> network address

00000000.00000000.000000000.01111111
0.0.0.127 

192.168.1.127 -> Broadcast

126 usable hosts
```
```
192.168.2.5/26 -> IP
11000000.10101000.00000010.00000101

11111111.11111111.11111111.11000000
255.255.255.192 -> Netmask

11000000.10101000.00000010.00000000
192.168.2.0 -> Network address

00000000.00000000.00000000.00111111
0.0.0.63

192.168.2.63 -> Broadcast

62 usable hosts
```
```
192.168.2.100/27 -> IP
11000000.10101000.00000010.01100100

11111111.11111111.11111111.11100000
255.255.255.224 -> Netmask

11000000.10101000.00000010.01100000
192.168.2.96 -> Network address

00000000.00000000.00000000.00011111
0.0.0.31

192.168.1.96 -> fourth block -> Broadcast

30 usable hosts
```
